means: 假装，伪装( feign的过去式和过去分词 )

sentence.Network_en: "Giles phoned this morning," Mirella said with feigned indifference.
sentence.Network_cn: “贾尔斯今早来电话了，”米雷拉装作若无其事地说。

sentence.Network_en: Sally spun round, a feigned look of surprise on her face.
sentence.Network_cn: 萨莉急转过身来，脸上装出一副吃惊的表情。

sentence.Network_en: He feigned indifference to criticism of his work.
sentence.Network_cn: 他假装毫不在意别人批评他的作品.

entry.def: If someone feigns a particular feeling, attitude, or physical condition, they try to make other people think that they have it or are experiencing it, although this is not true.

example.ex: One morning, I didn't want to go to school, and decided to feign illness...
example.tran: 有天早晨我不想上学，于是决定装病。

example.ex: 'Giles phoned this morning,' Mirella said with feigned indifference.
example.tran: “贾尔斯今早来电话了，”米雷拉装作若无其事地说。

auth_sentence.content: The dismay you express is feigned and myopic.

auth_sentence.content: So the pair have at least feigned a united front.
auth_sentence.res_content: So the pair have at least feigned a united front.

auth_sentence.content: Charlotte...feigned a weakness she did not entirely feel.

sentences.en: He accepted the invitation with feigned enthusiasm.
sentences.cn: 他假装热情地接受了邀请。
